title: FFU Builder Configuration
description: Configuration schema for FFU Builder - a Windows deployment acceleration tool that creates pre-configured Windows 11 images deployable in under 2 minutes.

$schema.description: JSON Schema reference for IDE validation and autocomplete

_comment.description: Optional comment field for documentation purposes

configSchemaVersion.description: Schema version of this configuration file. Used for automatic migration of older configs. Configs without this field are treated as version 0.0 (pre-versioning).

AllowExternalHardDiskMedia.description: When set to true, allows the use of media identified as External Hard Disk media via WMI class Win32_DiskDrive.

AllowVHDXCaching.description: When set to true, caches the VHDX file to the FFUDevelopmentPath\VHDXCache folder and creates a config json file that tracks Windows build information, installed updates, and logical sector byte size.

AppListPath.description: Path to a JSON file containing a list of applications to install using WinGet. Default is FFUDevelopmentPath\Apps\AppList.json.

AppsScriptVariables.description: Hashtable containing key-value pairs to pass variables to the Apps script. Creates an AppsScriptVariables.json file in the OrchestrationPath.

BuildUSBDrive.description: When set to true, partitions and formats a USB drive and copies the captured FFU to the drive.

CleanupAppsISO.description: When set to true, removes the Apps ISO after the FFU has been captured.

CleanupCaptureISO.description: When set to true, removes the WinPE capture ISO after the FFU has been captured.

CleanupCurrentRunDownloads.description: When set to true, removes downloads from the current build run on completion or failure.

CleanupDeployISO.description: When set to true, removes the WinPE deployment ISO after the FFU has been captured.

CleanupDrivers.description: When set to true, removes the drivers folder after the FFU has been captured.

CompactOS.description: When set to true, compacts the OS when building the FFU to reduce image size.

CompressDownloadedDriversToWim.description: When set to true, compresses downloaded drivers into a WIM file for more efficient storage.

ConfigFile.description: Path to a JSON file containing parameters to use for the script. Used for loading saved configurations.

AdditionalFFUFiles.description: Array of paths to additional FFU files to copy to the USB drive when CopyAdditionalFFUFiles is set to true.

CopyAdditionalFFUFiles.description: When set to true, copies additional FFU files specified in AdditionalFFUFiles to the USB drive.

CopyAutopilot.description: When set to true, copies the FFUDevelopmentPath\Autopilot folder to the Deployment partition of the USB drive.

CopyDrivers.description: When set to true, copies the drivers from the FFUDevelopmentPath\Drivers folder to the Drivers folder on the deploy partition of the USB drive.

CopyPEDrivers.description: When set to true, enables adding WinPE drivers. By default copies drivers from FFUDevelopmentPath\PEDrivers to the WinPE deployment media.

CopyPPKG.description: When set to true, copies the provisioning package from the FFUDevelopmentPath\PPKG folder to the Deployment partition of the USB drive.

CopyUnattend.description: When set to true, copies the FFUDevelopmentPath\Unattend folder to the Deployment partition of the USB drive.

CreateCaptureMedia.description: When set to true, creates WinPE capture media for use when InstallApps is set to true. This capture media will be automatically attached to the VM.

CreateDeploymentMedia.description: When set to true, creates WinPE deployment media for use when deploying to a physical device.

CustomFFUNameTemplate.description: Sets a custom FFU output name with placeholders. Allowed placeholders: {WindowsRelease}, {WindowsVersion}, {SKU}, {BuildDate}, {yyyy}, {MM}, {dd}, {H}, {hh}, {mm}, {tt}.

Disksize.description: Size of the virtual hard disk for the virtual machine in bytes. Range: 25GB (26843545600) to 2TB (2199023255552). Default is 30GB.

DriversFolder.description: Path to the drivers folder. Default is FFUDevelopmentPath\Drivers.

DriversJsonPath.description: Path to a JSON file that specifies which drivers to download for OEM deployments.

ExportConfigFile.description: Path to a JSON file to export the parameters used for the script for future reuse.

FFUCaptureLocation.description: Path to the folder where the captured FFU will be stored. Default is FFUDevelopmentPath\FFU.

FFUDevelopmentPath.description: Path to the FFU development folder. Leave empty to use the UI's script location automatically.

FFUPrefix.description: Prefix for the generated FFU file. Must contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens.

HypervisorType.description: Specifies which hypervisor to use for VM operations. 'HyperV' = Microsoft Hyper-V (default, requires Hyper-V feature), 'VMware' = VMware Workstation Pro 17.x, 'Auto' = auto-detect available hypervisor.

VMwareSettings.description: VMware Workstation Pro network configuration settings

NetworkType.description: Network connection type: 'nat' (share host IP), 'bridged' (direct network access), 'hostonly' (isolated)

NicType.description: Virtual network adapter type: 'e1000e' (recommended for WinPE), 'vmxnet3' (best performance, requires VMware Tools), 'e1000' (legacy)

VirtualDiskFormat.description: Virtual disk format to use. 'VHDX' is supported by Hyper-V only. 'VHD' works with both Hyper-V and VMware.

Headers.description: HTTP headers to use when downloading files. Contains browser-like headers to avoid download failures on Microsoft sites.

InjectUnattend.description: When set to true and InstallApps is also true, copies unattend_[arch].xml from FFUDevelopmentPath\unattend to FFUDevelopmentPath\Apps\Unattend\Unattend.xml for sysprep inside the VM.

InstallApps.description: When set to true, creates an Apps.iso file from the FFUDevelopmentPath\Apps folder, creates a VM, mounts the Apps.iso, installs the apps, runs sysprep, and captures the VM.

InstallDrivers.description: Install device drivers from the specified FFUDevelopmentPath\Drivers folder if set to true. The script will recurse the drivers folder and add the drivers to the FFU.

InstallOffice.description: Install Microsoft Office if set to true. The script will download the latest ODT and Office files and install Office in the FFU via VM.

ISOPath.description: Path to the Windows 10/11 ISO file. Required if downloading is not supported for the selected Windows release.

LogicalSectorSizeBytes.description: Logical sector size in bytes. Use 4096 for 4Kn drives or devices shipping with UFS drives.

Make.description: Make of the device to download drivers. Required if automatic driver download is desired.

MaxUSBDrives.description: Maximum number of USB drives to build in parallel. Set to 0 to process all discovered drives.

MediaType.description: Media type to download. 'consumer' for retail media, 'business' for volume license media.

Memory.description: Amount of memory to allocate for the virtual machine in bytes. Range: 2GB (2147483648) to 128GB (137438953472). Recommended: 8GB for Windows 11.

Model.description: Model of the device to download drivers. Required if Make is set.

OfficeConfigXMLFile.description: Path to a custom Office configuration XML file to use for installation instead of the default.

Optimize.description: When set to true, optimizes the FFU file for smaller size and faster deployment.

OptionalFeatures.description: Semicolon-separated list of Windows optional features to include in the FFU (e.g., 'netfx3;TFTP').

OrchestrationPath.description: Path to the orchestration folder containing scripts that run inside the VM. Default is FFUDevelopmentPath\Apps\Orchestration.

PEDriversFolder.description: Path to the folder containing drivers to be injected into the WinPE deployment media. Default is FFUDevelopmentPath\PEDrivers.

Processors.description: Number of virtual processors for the virtual machine. Recommended: at least 4 for reasonable build times.

ProductKey.description: Product key for the Windows edition specified in WindowsSKU. Recommended for MAK or KMS keys to activate Enterprise or Education.

PromptExternalHardDiskMedia.description: When set to true, prompts the user to confirm the use of media identified as External Hard Disk media.

RemoveApps.description: When set to true, removes the application content in the Apps folder after the FFU has been captured.

RemoveFFU.description: When set to true, removes the FFU file from the FFUDevelopmentPath\FFU folder after it has been copied to the USB drive.

RemoveUpdates.description: When set to true, removes the downloaded CU, MSRT, Defender, Edge, OneDrive, and .NET files.

ShareName.description: Name of the shared folder for FFU capture. Must contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, hyphens, and dollar signs.

UpdateADK.description: When set to true, checks for and installs the latest Windows ADK and WinPE add-on if they are not already installed or up-to-date.

UpdateEdge.description: When set to true, downloads and installs the latest Microsoft Edge.

UpdateLatestCU.description: When set to true, downloads and installs the latest cumulative update.

UpdateLatestDefender.description: When set to true, downloads and installs the latest Windows Defender definitions and Defender platform update.

UpdateLatestMicrocode.description: When set to true, downloads and installs the latest microcode updates for applicable Windows releases (e.g., Windows Server 2016/2019, Windows 10 LTSC 2016/2019).

UpdateLatestMSRT.description: When set to true, downloads and installs the latest Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool.

UpdateLatestNet.description: When set to true, downloads and installs the latest .NET Framework.

UpdateOneDrive.description: When set to true, downloads and installs the latest OneDrive as a per-machine installation instead of per-user.

UpdatePreviewCU.description: When set to true, downloads and installs the latest Preview cumulative update instead of the stable release.

IncludePreviewUpdates.description: When set to true, allows preview/optional updates in Windows Update searches. When false (default), search queries exclude preview updates to ensure only GA (Generally Available) releases are downloaded. Affects Cumulative Updates and .NET Framework updates.

UseDriversAsPEDrivers.description: When set to true (and CopyPEDrivers is also true), bypasses PEDrivers folder and builds the WinPE driver set dynamically from the DriversFolder path.

UserAgent.default: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/125.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/125.0.0.0
UserAgent.description: User agent string to use when downloading files to avoid download failures on Microsoft sites.

UserAppListPath.description: Path to a JSON file containing a list of user-defined applications to install. Default is FFUDevelopmentPath\Apps\UserAppList.json.

Username.description: Username for accessing the shared folder. The script will auto-create the account and password, and remove the account when finished.

USBDriveList.description: Hashtable containing USB drives from win32_diskdrive. Key: USB drive model name (partial match). Value: USB drive serial number (trailing partial match).

VMHostIPAddress.description: IP address of the Hyper-V host for FFU capture. Required if InstallApps is set to true.

ShowVMConsole.description: When set to true, displays the VM window during the build process (VMware only). When false (default), the VM runs in headless mode for automation. Hyper-V uses Hyper-V Manager for console access.

ForceVMwareDriverDownload.description: When set to true, forces re-download of Intel e1000e network drivers for VMware WinPE support, replacing any existing drivers in the VMwareDrivers folder. Use when a previous download failed or drivers appear corrupted. Only applicable when using VMware Workstation Pro.

VMwareNetworkType.description: VMware network connection type: 'nat' (share host IP, default), 'bridged' (direct network access), 'hostonly' (isolated from external networks). Only applicable when HypervisorType is 'VMware'.

VMwareNicType.description: VMware virtual network adapter type: 'e1000e' (recommended for WinPE compatibility, default), 'vmxnet3' (best performance but requires VMware Tools drivers), 'e1000' (legacy compatibility). Only applicable when HypervisorType is 'VMware'.

VMLocation.description: Location of the VHDX that gets created where Windows will be installed. Default is FFUDevelopmentPath\VM.

VMSwitchName.description: Name of the Hyper-V virtual switch. Required if InstallApps is set to true for FFU capture from the VM.

VMShutdownTimeoutMinutes.description: Maximum time in minutes to wait for VM shutdown before forcing power off. If the VM does not shutdown within this timeout, it will be forcibly powered off and the build will continue.

WindowsArch.description: Architecture of Windows to download and deploy.

WindowsLang.description: Language of Windows media to download in language-region format (e.g., 'en-us', 'fr-ca').

WindowsRelease.description: Windows release version. 10 or 11 for client OS; 2016, 2019, 2021, 2022, 2024, 2025 for server OS.

WindowsSKU.description: Edition of Windows to install. Client SKUs (Home, Pro, Education, Enterprise) for Windows 10/11; Server SKUs and LTSC for server releases.

AppsPath.description: [DEPRECATED] Legacy property - no longer used. The Apps folder path is now derived from FFUDevelopmentPath automatically. This property is ignored but accepted for backward compatibility.

CopyOfficeConfigXML.description: [DEPRECATED] Legacy property - no longer used. Use OfficeConfigXMLFile to specify a custom Office configuration XML file instead. This property is ignored but accepted for backward compatibility.

DownloadDrivers.description: [DEPRECATED] Legacy property - no longer used. Use Make and Model parameters to enable automatic driver downloads. This property is ignored but accepted for backward compatibility.

InstallWingetApps.description: [DEPRECATED] Legacy property - no longer used. Use InstallApps and AppListPath instead for WinGet app installation. This property is ignored but accepted for backward compatibility.

OfficePath.description: [DEPRECATED] Legacy property - no longer used. The Office folder path is now derived from FFUDevelopmentPath automatically. This property is ignored but accepted for backward compatibility.

Threads.description: [DEPRECATED] Legacy property - no longer used. Parallel processing is now managed automatically. This property is ignored but accepted for backward compatibility.

Verbose.description: [DEPRECATED] Legacy property - no longer used in config files. Use the -Verbose switch when running BuildFFUVM.ps1 from the command line instead. This property is ignored but accepted for backward compatibility.

CleanupCaptureVM.description: When set to true, removes the capture VM after the FFU has been captured successfully.

UpdateLatestNet48.description: When set to true, downloads and installs the latest .NET Framework 4.8.

VMName.description: Name of the virtual machine to create for FFU building. Must contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens.

SharePath.description: Path to the shared folder for FFU capture. Default is FFUDevelopmentPath when empty.

_description.description: Optional description field for documentation purposes
